content.question: What is the volume of the solid generated when the region bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, x cubed, minus 8, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, x to the sixth power, minus 64, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>64</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, x cubed, minus 8, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, x cubed, plus 8, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, x cubed, minus 8, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.10: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
